pages.title: Overview
pages.content:
## Ark.Alliance.Portfolio

**Production-Grade Portfolio CMS & Static Site Generator**

A comprehensive portfolio platform that goes beyond simple showcases. It combines enterprise-grade software practices with AI-powered content generation, full content management capabilities, and one-click static site deployment.

### Perfect For

- üíº **Professionals** ‚Äî Showcase work experience and projects with dynamic CMS
- üéì **Academics** ‚Äî Document research, publications, and teaching
- üé® **Creatives** ‚Äî Present portfolio work with rich media management
- üíª **Engineers** ‚Äî Demonstrate technical projects with multi-page documentation
- üè¢ **Agencies** ‚Äî Manage team portfolios with collaborative features

### Core Capabilities

| Capability | Description |
|------------|-------------|
| **Content Management** | 20 TypeORM entities covering all portfolio aspects |
| **AI Content Creation** | Multi-provider AI (OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini) |
| **Static Site Export** | One-click deployment to any static host |
| **Multi-Page Projects** | Rich documentation with Markdown + Mermaid |
| **Dynamic Theming** | Runtime theme switching, no reload required |
| **Media Management** | Upload, organize, and optimize assets |\
| **Type Safety** | End-to-end TypeScript with shared DTOs |
| **Security** | JWT auth, bcrypt, AES-256, Helmet headers |

### Technology Stack

**Frontend**
- React 18 with TypeScript 5.x
- Vite build tool
- MVVM component architecture
- React Router for navigation
- Axios for API communication

**Backend**
- Node.js 18+ with Express
- TypeORM for data access
- SQLite (dev) / PostgreSQL (prod)
- 16 business services
- 9 API controllers

**Shared**
- TypeScript DTOs
- Shared enumerations
- Type-safe contracts

**AI Integration**
- OpenAI GPT-4 & GPT-4 Turbo
- Anthropic Claude 3 (Opus, Sonnet, Haiku)
- Google Gemini 1.5 (Pro, Flash)

### Key Statistics

- **20** TypeORM Entities
- **16** Backend Services  
- **9** API Controllers
- **235+** Test Cases (100% pass rate)
- **3** Architecture Layers
- **3** AI Providers

### Quick Start

```bash
# Install shared library
cd Ark.Portfolio.Share
npm install && npm run build

# Start backend (port 3085)
cd ../Ark.Portfolio.Backend
npm install && npm run dev

# Start frontend (port 3080)
cd ../Ark.Portfolio.UI
npm install && npm run dev
```

Default admin credentials: `admin` / `admin123`

pages.content:
## Functional Use Cases

### 1. Portfolio Content Management

**Scenario**: Professional wants to maintain a dynamic portfolio with CMS

**Workflow**:
1. Admin logs in with JWT authentication
2. Navigate to Admin Dashboard
3. Create/update profile information (name, title, summary, contact)
4. Add work experiences with:
   - Company, role, dates
   - Detailed descriptions
   - Technology tags
5. Create projects with:
   - Title, description, status
   - Repository and demo URLs
   - Hero images
6. Add multi-page project documentation
7. Upload media assets (images, PDFs, videos)
8. Configure homepage carousel
9. Publish changes (live update)

**Benefits**:
- ‚úÖ Centralized content management
- ‚úÖ Version control through database
- ‚úÖ Type-safe data structures
- ‚úÖ Real-time preview
- ‚úÖ No code deployments needed

![Projects Management](/Assets/Projects/Ark.Portfolio/Admin_Projects.PNG)

*Manage projects with full CRUD operations and multi-page documentation*

---

### 2. AI-Assisted Content Generation

**Scenario**: User needs professional content for project descriptions

**Workflow**:
1. Navigate to **AI Settings** in admin panel
2. Configure AI provider:
   - Choose: OpenAI, Anthropic, or Gemini
   - Select model (GPT-4, Claude 3 Opus, Gemini 1.5 Pro)
   - Enter API key (encrypted with AES-256)
3. Select content entity (Project, Experience, Skill, etc.)
4. Write prompt or select template:
   - "Generate a professional project summary"
   - "Create compelling feature descriptions"
   - "Write technical documentation"
5. Review AI-generated content
6. Edit and refine as needed
7. Save to entity

**Supported Operations**:
- üìù Content generation from prompts
- üìÑ Text summarization
- ‚ú® Professional writing enhancement
- üìö Technical documentation assistance
- üéØ SEO optimization suggestions

**AI Provider Comparison**:

| Provider | Best For | Models Available |
|----------|----------|------------------|
| OpenAI | General purpose, code | GPT-4, GPT-4 Turbo |
| Anthropic | Long-form content, analysis | Claude 3 Opus, Sonnet, Haiku |
| Google Gemini | Multi-modal, structured data | Gemini 1.5 Pro, Flash |

---

### 3. Static Website Deployment

**Scenario**: Deploy portfolio to static hosting (zero server costs)

**Workflow**:
1. Populate all CMS content (profile, projects, experiences)
2. Configure visual theme (Architectural or Aloe Vera)
3. Navigate to **Export** ‚Üí **Static Site** in admin
4. Click **"Generate Static Website"**
5. System processes:
   - Renders all React components to HTML
   - Bundles CSS with theme variables
   - Optimizes JavaScript bundle
   - Copies media assets
   - Generates sitemap.xml
   - Creates SEO meta tags
6. Download ZIP file (typically 5-15 MB)
7. Extract and deploy to:
   - **GitHub Pages**: Push to `gh-pages` branch
   - **Netlify**: Drag-drop ZIP or connect repo
   - **Vercel**: Import from GitHub
   - **AWS S3 + CloudFront**: Upload to S3 bucket

**Advantages**:
- üí∞ Zero server costs
- üöÄ Infinite scalability via CDN
- ‚ö° Fast loading times (static assets)
- üîí Maximum security (no backend to attack)
- üåç Global CDN distribution
- üì± Mobile-optimized responsive design

**Generated Structure**:
```
static-export.zip
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.html
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ projects.html
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ resume.html
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ assets/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ images/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ css/
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ js/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ sitemap.xml
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ robots.txt
```

---

### 4. Dynamic Theming System

**Scenario**: Customize portfolio appearance without code changes

**Workflow**:
1. Access **StyleConfig** in admin panel
2. Choose from built-in themes:
   - **Architectural**: Clean, minimalist, structural aesthetic
   - **Aloe Vera**: Organic, nature-inspired, warm tones
3. Or create custom theme with JSON:
   ```json

       "primary": "#3B82F6",

features.title: Multi-Provider Abstraction
features.description: Unified interface for Binance Futures and Deribit exchanges with IProviderClient pattern. Write once, trade on any supported exchange without code changes. Extensible architecture for adding new providers.

features.title: Result Pattern Error Handling
features.description: Type-safe Result<T> pattern for functional error handling. No exceptions in normal flow, explicit success/failure states, chainable operations (map, flatMap), and comprehensive error details with ResultStatus enum.

features.title: Real-Time WebSocket Streams
features.description: Low-latency market data via WebSocket connections. Subscribe to klines, book ticker, user data streams, and order events. Event-driven architecture with typed event emitters for order fills and position updates.

features.title: Secure Authentication
features.description: HMAC-SHA256 signature generation for Binance, Ed25519 signature generation for Deribit, automatic token refresh mechanisms, and secure credential storage with IAuthStrategy interface.

features.title: Comprehensive Testing
features.description: 70+ test scenarios with ReflectionTestEngine, scenario-driven JSON test definitions, dynamic parameter resolution ($DYNAMIC_LIMIT_BUY), tested against live testnets, and 100% pass rate across all categories.

features.title: Clean Architecture
features.description: Domain-driven design with clear layer separation: Domain (entities, interfaces), Application (use cases, mappers), and Infrastructure (clients, auth). TypeScript-first with full IntelliSense support.

pages.title: Overview
Architecture
pages.content:
## Clean Architecture

### Layer Structure

```
Domain Layer
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Domain Entities (Order, Position, Account)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Interfaces (IProviderClient, IAuthStrategy)
        ‚Üì
Application Layer
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Use Cases (Place Order, Get Position)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Data Mappers (API ‚Üî Domain)
        ‚Üì
Infrastructure Layer
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ API Clients (REST, WebSocket)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Authentication (HMAC, Ed25519)
        ‚Üì
External Systems
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Exchange APIs (Binance, Deribit)
```

### Provider Abstraction

**Your Application**

‚Üì Uses

**IProviderClient Interface**
- connect() / disconnect()
- isConnected() / getProviderName()

‚Üì Implemented by

**Provider Implementations**
- Binance Provider (REST + WebSocket)
- Deribit Provider (JSON-RPC)

‚Üì Uses

**IAuthStrategy Interface**
- generateSignature()
- authenticate()

‚Üì Connects to

**External APIs**
- Binance Futures API (HTTPS + WSS)
- Deribit API (WebSocket JSON-RPC)

## Ark.Alliance.Trading.TrendsCalculator

### Core Services

| Service | Lines | Responsibility |
|---------|-------|----------------|
| `TrendCalculatorService` | 751 | Trend calculation engine |
| `BinanceStreamService` | 290 | Market data ingestion |
| `SymbolTrackingService` | 220 | Symbol lifecycle |
| `StreamingAnalysisService` | 330 | Real-time processing |
| `MarketDataService` | 180 | Data aggregation |

### Mathematical Indicators

**Hurst Exponent** ‚Äî Market memory analysis
- H < 0.5: Mean-reverting (range trading)
- H ‚âà 0.5: Random walk (neutral)
- H > 0.5: Trending (momentum)

**GARCH** ‚Äî Volatility forecasting
- Predicts next-period variance
- Identifies volatility clustering

**Linear Regression** ‚Äî Trend direction
- Slope: direction and steepness
- R¬≤: trend reliability (0-1)

**EMA Crossover** ‚Äî MA bias
- EMA 50 > EMA 200: Bullish
- EMA 50 < EMA 200: Bearish

pages.title: Features & Use Cases
pages.content:
## Functional Use Cases

### 1. Algorithmic Trading Bot Integration

**Scenario**: Trading bot needs trend signals for entry timing

**Workflow**:
1. Bot connects via WebSocket
2. Subscribes to symbol (e.g., BTCUSDT)
3. Receives `buffer:progress` events during warmup
4. Receives `trend:update` events with direction + strength
5. Executes trades based on composite score threshold

**Benefits**:
- Sub-second latency
- Confidence scoring
- Multiple indicator confirmation

### 2. Multi-Symbol Portfolio Screening

**Scenario**: Analyst monitors 20 symbols for strong trends

**Workflow**:
1. Track multiple symbols via REST API
2. Receive parallel WebSocket updates
3. Filter by strength > 0.7
4. Request AI analysis for top candidates
5. Make informed allocation decisions

**Benefits**:
- Parallel processing
- Unified trend view
- AI-augmented insights

### 3. Walk-Forward Strategy Validation

**Scenario**: Quant validates indicator parameters

**Workflow**:
1. Start training session with historical data
2. System splits into train/test periods
3. Parameters optimized on training data
4. Validated against test data
5. Accuracy metrics reported per direction

**Benefits**:
- Avoid overfitting
- Direction-specific accuracy
- Parameter optimization

### 4. Real-Time Dashboard Monitoring

**UI Pages**:
- **Overview**: Summary metrics and active symbols
- **Symbols**: Add/remove tracking with buffer progress
- **Visualization**: Live price charts with trend overlays
- **Configuration**: AI settings and parameters
- **Training**: Validation metrics and history

pages.title: Deployment & Integration
pages.content:
## Deployment

### Prerequisites

- Node.js >= 18.0.0
- npm >= 8.0.0
- Binance account (optional, for live data)
- Google Gemini API key (optional, for AI)

### Quick Start

```bash
# 1. Install Share layer
cd Ark.Alliance.TrendsCalculator.Share
npm install && npm run build

# 2. Start Backend
cd ../Ark.Alliance.TrendsCalculator.Backend
npm install
cp .env.example .env
npm run dev

# 3. Start Frontend
cd ../Ark.Alliance.TrendsCalculator.Ui
npm install
npm run dev
```

### Environment Variables

```env
# Server
PORT=3001
NODE_ENV=development

# Binance
BINANCE_API_KEY=your_key
BINANCE_SECRET_KEY=your_secret
BINANCE_USE_TESTNET=true

# AI (optional)
GEMINI_API_KEY=your_gemini_key

# Calculation
DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE=200
MIN_BUFFER_SIZE=50
```

## API Integration

### REST Endpoints

| Endpoint | Method | Purpose |
|----------|--------|---------|
| `/api/health` | GET | Health check |
| `/api/symbol/track` | POST | Start tracking |
| `/api/symbol/:symbol/track` | DELETE | Stop tracking |
| `/api/symbol/:symbol/status` | GET | Buffer status |
| `/api/trend/:symbol/analyze` | GET | Current trend |
| `/api/trend/:symbol/history` | GET | Trend history |

### WebSocket Events

**Server ‚Üí Client**:
- `trend:update` ‚Äî Trend analysis result
- `buffer:progress` ‚Äî Buffer filling status
- `symbol:added` ‚Äî Symbol tracking started
- `ai:analysis` ‚Äî AI analysis result

**Client ‚Üí Server**:
- `subscribe:symbol` ‚Äî Subscribe to updates
- `unsubscribe:symbol` ‚Äî Unsubscribe

### Example Consumer

```typescript
import { io } from 'socket.io-client';

const socket = io('wss://trends-api.example.com');

socket.emit('subscribe:symbol', 'BTCUSDT');

socket.on('trend:update', (data) => {
  console.log(`${data.symbol}: ${data.direction}`);
  console.log(`Strength: ${data.strength}`);
  console.log(`Composite: ${data.compositeScore}`);
});
```
